channel.title: I can't describe how happy I am
channel.description:
Well I just went to Gamestop and bought 3 games that I have been dying to play: Tales of Vesperia Custom Robo Megaman Network Transmission
The latter two I've rented YEARS ago and have missed Playing them for so long. ToV I've seen gameplays for and looked great because I'm a sucker for the Tales series :P Anyways, I'm sitting in the mall right now, so I can't play them :/ but... Does anyone else know of or have been lucky enough to find a good oldie that they love? I just can't believe I found all three within the same 15 square feet xD

item.title: I can't describe how happy I am

item.description:
@R_A_R_E_S wrote:

The game exchange is the best place to get older games in my opinion

item.title: I can't describe how happy I am
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Um, I found a old PS1 and N64 in my attic. PS1 had 2 games, Grand Turismo 1&2. N64 had 1 game, Super Mario World. A week ago I bought a working nintendo and super-nintendo at a garage sale ($5 for both), each had 2 remotes + no games. Plan to get a couple games on ebay.

Read full topic
item.source: I can't describe how happy I am

item.title: I can't describe how happy I am
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“orcashark, post:11, topic:372717”]The Legend of Zelda Orcorina of Time.
Fucking miss that game so much. Last time i played it was on Gamecube back in 04 i believe.[/quote]

I LOVE THAT GAME SOOO MUCH

Look up Nintendo 64 Emulator, and Ocarina Of Time ROM n64 (they let you play n64 games on PC’s)

Read full topic

item.title: I can't describe how happy I am
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:5, topic:372717”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=468753.msg3427113#msg3427113 date=1292032304]
How are you on Mopar in the mall?
[/quote]Maybe an internet ready phone?[/quote]

Ah, yes. I tried Mopar on my iPhone, but it’s only mobile-design until I log in.
@OP: Original Paper Mario for N64. Bought it on the Nintendo Wii Network thingy, than got an emulator. But yeah, n64 was my first console, and I ALWAYS rented Paper Mario from game stores because it was so awesome. Nostalgia ftw.

Read full topic
